OGC API Processes
Processing geospatial data on the web
Tell Me More Get Started

Why?

Main reasons for using OGC API Processes.

Interoperable

Ensure that algorythems are deployable into serverside processing systems. Data can therefore be processed close to theire storage to avoid unnecessary download.

Based on Best Practices

This API is developed and enhanced based on good practise guidance and implemented in productive processing services serving huge number of users with data producs on demand.

Supported on Existing Products

You can start using the OGC API Processing specification today, by tapping into one of the existing server or client implementations.

Overview

OGC API Processes provides options to process geospatial data remotly.

  • Get

    Lists the existing proceses

  • Get items

    To be written.

  • Delete

    Stop a running process

If you are interested in finding out how-to set up an application you can see this tutorial : TODO: Climate application packages.

See it In Action

This is a list of server implementations, that provide data. Please get in touch , if you would like to add your server to the list.

Inpainting missing values

Powered by CLINT

Description for Duck.

Use it

Do you want to start using OGC API Features? Before starting to implement the spec, please take a look at the existing implementations.

Servers by Technology
Java Ldproxy * /
Geoserver /
Deegree * /
Python pygeoapi * /
GeoPortal
JavaScript Sofp /
C/C++ QGIS Server /
GNOSIS Map Server *
Clients by Technology
Python OWSLib /
Pygdal Check GDAL's documentation .
JavaScript ogcapi-js /
C/C++ GDAL /
Integration framework Apache Camel /

* Certified compliant product.

Who is behind OGC API Features?

OGC API Features is developed through a member-driven consensus process, which creates royalty free, publicly available, open geospatial standards. The Open Geospatial Consortium (OGC) is the organisation which drives this process. It is supported by an active community of members, with involvement from a large range of organizations, as well as smaller ones. Join OGC today!

The logos above are a small subset of all OGC members. They are either strategic/principal members, and/or organisations who implement products certified for OGC API Features.

Get Started

Here is something to get you started.

  • Complete an online training

    If you are familiar with web services and APIs, and want to have an overview of the OGC API - Features standard, this training is for you.

  • Follow a tutorial

    Implement a complete pipeline to make your data available with OGC API - Features, using a stack of free and open source software. A video version is available here.

  • Get
    Involved!

Get Involved

Tell us what’s working well, what you want to see added or improved, and find out about new updates.

Stack Overflow

Engage with your peers and ask questions about OGC API Features using the tag 'OGC API Features'

Discord

Chat with other OGC API Features users in the OGC Community channel.

GitHub

Found a bug, or want to give us constructive feedback?

Privacy Policy

Privacy Policy

OGC API Features does not log or share your personal information.

We don't track you. We don't profile you. Period
